RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui mestrado em Geocincias na Universit degli Studi di Trieste, Itlia (2012). Desde maro de 2018 tem doutorado pela Universidade Federal de Ouro Preto (MG, Brasil) a partir de outubro de 2013. Desde novembro de 2018 tem ps-doutorado no Instituto de Astronomia, Geofsica e Cincias Ambientais da Universidade de So Paulo (SP, Brasil). com projeto de oxidao da atmosfera e dos oceanos durante dois grandes perodos de transio, o Grande Evento de Oxidao (~ 2.45 e 2.2 Ga) e o Evento de Oxidao Neoproterozico (~ 0.80 e 0.54 Ga). Tem experincia em geoqumica, geocronologia, petrologia clssica e experimental. Os estudos enfocam principalmente os seguintes tpicos: geocronologia de sedimentos e geoqumica isotpica relacionados aos perodos de oxidao da Terra, geoqumica e geocronologia de minerais acessrios pelo estudo de magmas flsicos a ultramficos, petrologia experimental para estudar a (s) fonte (s) de granitos e magmas em geral; geologia e geodinmica da transio Arqueano-Paleoproterozico, Neoproterozico e Trissico Mdio. Juntamente com esses projetos, outros que esto sendo desenvolvidos so: xenlitos de manto e corpos peridotticos, gerao de basaltos alcalinos e ultra-alcalinos. Emfim, ele est interessado em estudar o magmatismo ultramfico arqueano komatitico.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Has a master's degree in Geosciences at the Universit degli Studi di Trieste, Italy (2012). Since March 2018 has a doctorate from the Federal University of Ouro Preto (MG, Brazil) beginning in October 2013. Since November 2018 has a postdoctorate at the Institute of Astronomy, Geophysics and Environmental Sciences of the University of So Paulo (SP, Brazil) with project on oxidation of the atmosphere and oceans during two major transitional periods, the Great Oxidation Event (~ 2.45 and 2.2 Ga) and the Neoproterozoic Oxidation Event (~ 0.80 and 0.54 Ga). Has experience in geochemistry, geochronology, classical and experimental petrology. Studies focus mainly on the following topics: sediment geochronology and isotopic geochemistry related to Earth oxidation periods, geochemistry and geochronology of accessory minerals by the study of felsic to ultramafic magmas, experimental petrology to study the source (s) of granites and magmas in general; geology and geodynamics of the Archean-Paleoproterozoic, Neoproterozoic and Triassic Medium transition. Along with these projects, others that are being developed are: mantle xenoliths and peridotitic bodies, generation of alkali and ultra-alkaline basalts. Finally, he is interested in studying Komatiitic Archean ultramafic magmatism.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Winner of n1 tutorship of n hours 100 for tutorial support in geological survey for the Earth Science area, at the Department of Mathematics and Geosciences, University of Trieste, Italy; June 24th ? July 5th, 2013

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Estudo geoqumico e petrolgico dos granitos cordileiranos pr-colisionais (Sute Galilia) do Orogeno Araua. O assunto do estudo refere-se ao entendimento da gnese e a fonte desses granitos: produzidos pela mistura de magmas mficos derivados do mantos com magmas de origem crustal, ou a fonte exclusivamente crustal? Para isto sero estudados minerais acessrios como zirco, titanita, granada e epidoto.
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Geochemical and petrological study of the pre-collisional cordilleran-type granitoids (Galilia suite) of the Araua orogen. The main object is to understand which is the genesis and source(s) of these granitoids: are these produced from a mixing between mafic-mantle derived and crustally derived magmas or are directly produced by the partial melting of and (meta)igneous rock? In order to answer to these questions, the more powerful accessory minerals such as zircon, titanite, garnet, and epidote will be investigated.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Genesis and evolution of a Neoproterozoic magmatic arc: the Cordilleran-type granitoids of the Araua Belt, Brazil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Estudo geoqumico e petrolgico dos granitos cordileiranos pr-colisionais (Sute Galilia) do Orogeno Araua. O assunto do estudo refere-se ao entendimento da gnese e a fonte desses granitos: produzidos pela mistura de magmas mficos derivados do mantos com magmas de origem crustal, ou a fonte exclusivamente crustal? Para isto sero estudados minerais acessrios como zirco, titanita, granada e epidoto.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Geochemical and petrological study of the pre-collisional cordilleran-type granitoids (Galilia suite) of the Araua orogen. The main object is to understand which is the genesis and source(s) of these granitoids: are these produced from a mixing between mafic-mantle derived and crustally derived magmas or are directly produced by the partial melting of and (meta)igneous rock? In order to answer to these questions, the more powerful accessory minerals such as zircon, titanite, garnet, and epidote will be investigated.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Genesis and evolution of a Neoproterozoic magmatic arc: the Cordilleran-type granitoids of the Araua Belt, Brazil

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Limites temporais, condies de oxi-reduo e fontes dos sedimentos relacionados ao aumento na oxygnao atmosfrica no Proterozoico no Brasil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A atmosfera e os oceanos se tornaram oxidados em dois perodos de transio principais, o Grande Evento de Oxidao (~ 2.45 e 2.2 Ga) e o Evento de Oxidao Neoproterozico (~ 0.80 e 0.54 Ga). Evidncias so encontradas na frica do Sul, Amrica do Norte, Austrlia Ocidental e Rssia. Porm, o tempo real, durao, mecanismo e alcance do aumento de O2 ainda so questes abertas devido a pobreza nas idades e as contradies nas correlaes estratigrficas entre esses diferentes terrenos. Curiosamente, vrios estudos enfatizaram uma possvel relao entre eventos de oxidao, eventos de glaciao global coevos e ampla atividade de grandes provncias gneas. No Brasil, rochas sedimentares que pertenciam as Provncias Paleoproterozicas de Carajs e do Quadrilatero Ferrifero e aos Grupos Neoproterozicos do Jacadigo e do Bambu foram depositadas durante os Eventos de Oxidao Grande e Neoproterozico, respectivamente. Apesar disso, eles no so considerados na reconstruo global por causa de uma investigao geocronolgica, elementar e isotpica ainda escassa. Isso impe uma caracterizao mais aprofundada. O objetivo deste projeto , portanto: i) constranger a idades dos Eventos de Oxidao Grande e Neoproterozico e os episdios glaciais associados por meio da geocronologia Re-Os em xistos negros e sulfetos sedimentares de unidades sedimentares chave do Brasil; ii) realizar a sistemtica isotpica de Nd - Hf nos mesmos sedimentos datados, em diamictitos glaciais e em carbonatos relacionados, do Brasil, e seus equivalentes do Oeste da Austrlia (Grupo do Turee Creek) para caracterizar as fontes de sedimentos e avaliar o papel potencial das grandes provncias gneas na oxigenao e resfriamento global da superfcie da Terra durante o Proterozico.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The atmosphere and oceans became oxidized across two main transitional periods, the Great Oxidation Event (~2.45 and 2.2 Ga) and the Neoproterozoic Oxidation Event (~0.80 and 0.54 Ga). Pieces of evidence are found in South Africa, North America, Western Australia and Russia, but the real timing, duration, mechanism and range of O2 increase are still unsolved question due to poor age constraints and contradictory stratigraphic correlations between these different terrains. Intriguingly, several studies have emphasized a possible causal relationship between oxidation events, coeval global glaciation events and widespread activity of subaerial large igneous provinces. In Brazil, sedimentary rocks of the Paleoproterozoic Carajs and Quadrilatero Ferrifero Mineral Provinces, and the Neoproterozoic Jacadigo and Bambu Groups were deposited during the Great and Neoproterozoic Events, respectively. Nevertheless, they are not considered in global reconstruction because of a still scanty geochronological, elemental and isotopic investigation. This imposes a deepened characterization. The aim of this project is, therefore: i) to constrain the timing of the Great and Neoproterozoic Oxidation Events, and associated glacial episodes through Re-Os geochronology of black shales and sedimentary sulphides of key sedimentary units from Brazil; ii) to perform Nd - Hf isotope systematics on the same organic-rich sediments, glacial diamictites and related carbonates from Brazil and their equivalent from Western Australia (Turee Creek Group) in order to characterize sediment sources and evaluate the potential role of Large Igneous Province in the oxygenation and global cooling of the Erath surface during the Proterozoic.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Time constraints, redox conditions and sediment sources attending the Proterozoic rise of atmospheric oxygen in Brazil

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Extreme U-Pb zircon age variability in the lower crustal Galilia Batholith (SE Brazil)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The garnet-epidote-bearing cordilleran-type Galilia Batholith (30000 km2) appears to have been assembled in the lower crust (> 0.8 GPa) between ca. 630 and ca. 570 Ma [1]. New U-Pb zircon LA-ICP-MS dating on metaluminous to peraluminous granitoids from the batholith disclose an intriguingly long potential crystallization history, that is consistent with the proposed >10kbar crystallisation indicated by the mineralogy and mineral chemistry of the rocks [1]. In most cases, the scatter of U-Pb zircon dates from a single sample cannot be explained by analytical uncertainties alone, yielding weighted mean dates with considerable over-dispersion (MSWD >> 1). In individual samples, the ages of oscillatory zoned, magmatic zircon, appears to record between ca. 20 to 50 Myrs of crystallisation suggesting extremely protracted zircon crystallisation. Hf isotopic compositions of the same zircon crystals show negative values, with εHf from -6 up to -16, and scattered behaviour, varying from 4 up to 10 εHf units per sample. Zircon ages and εHf are correlated, with εHf decreasing in young crystals, while zircon Th/U ratios appear to increase through time. The rare occurrence of dissolution textures in zircon suggest that the magma was kept near Zr-saturation for ca. 50 Myr. Collectively, these data suggest that the Galilia batholith was incrementally assembled over an extended period of time in a magmatic system that became progressively less radiogenic in Hf and enriched in Th. Overall, this might have been assisted by the fact that the Galilia Batholith was emplaced in the lower crust, as indicated by the coexistence of garnet, epidote and phengite in some samples. [1] Narduzzi et al. (2017) Lithos 282-283, 82-97.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: From high (> 0.8 GPa) to low (ca. 0.5 GPa) pressure crystallization: evidence from the grossular-rich magmatic garnets of the Galilia Batholith, Brazil
